claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

verified_evidence.quote: Flublok Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5 mL PFS ≥18 yrs 45 µg/0.5 mL IM
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote 'Flublok Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5 mL PFS ≥18 yrs 45 µg/0.5 mL IM' appears in the document as 'Flublok Quad rival ent (San of i Pasteur) 0.5 mL PFS ≥18 yrs 45 µg/0.5 mL IM'. The wording is slightly altered due to OCR artifacts, but the factual content, including the product name, manufacturer, dose, age indication, and HA content, is preserved.. The quote directly states that Flublok Quadrivalent contains 45 µg of hemagglutinin (HA) antigen per 0.5 mL dose. This is three times the 15 µg/0.5 mL dose found in standard-dose flu vaccines, as also shown elsewhere in the document for other products. Therefore, the quote supports the first part of the claim regarding HA content. However, the quote does not address the second part of the claim about greater immunogenicity, so it only partially supports the full claim.

The wording is slightly altered due to OCR artifacts, but the factual content, including the product name, manufacturer, dose, age indication, and HA content, is preserved.

However, the quote does not address the second part of the claim about greater immunogenicity, so it only partially supports the full claim.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote shows that Flublok contains 45 µg of hemagglutinin (HA) antigen per 0.5 mL dose, which is three times the 15 µg/0.5 mL dose found in standard-dose flu vaccines, directly supporting the first part of the claim.

verified_evidence.quote: Fluzone Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5-mL PFS†† ≥6 mos†† 15 µg/0.5 mL IM

The wording is slightly altered due to OCR artifacts, but the factual content (vaccine name, manufacturer, dose, age, HA content, and route) is preserved.. The quote provides the HA antigen content (15 µg/0.5 mL) for a standard-dose flu vaccine (Fluzone Quadrivalent). Thus, the quote directly supports the part of the claim regarding the HA content difference, which is foundational to the claim about greater immunogenicity.
